description:
Life sucks for Hibiki. Intergalactic society has broken into civil war between males and females; he's stuck on the assembly line for war mecha, relentlessly teased by his co-workers and unable to pursue his dreams of building his own mecha one day. He finally decides he's had enough though, and attempts to break in and steal a mech for his own purposes; this turns out to be a bad idea, thrusting him into the middle of a fever-pitch space battle that brings him face to face with the enemy and launches him into an adventure that will change his mundane life forever.

(Source: AnimeNfo)

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Space Opera
tags.description: Centers around space warfare, advanced technology, chivalric romance and adventure.

tags.name: Pirates
tags.description: Prominently features sea-faring adventurers branded as criminals by the law.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/193091/)._

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/石井明治)

Freelancer with deep ties to [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1219713270149341184)

Originating from Studio Comet, where he initially worked as a production assistant. He is friends with, and often collaborates with [Tatsuya Oishi](https://anilist.co/staff/103552/) and both [You](https://anilist.co/staff/102998/) and [Kou Yoshinari](https://anilist.co/staff/102136/). All three of them worked at Gainax together in the '90s.
A freelance animator and designer, started working for Gainax in Gunbuster and Fushigi no Umi no Nadia. He left Gainax to join Gonzo, where he developed the character designs for Vandread.
A freelance animator and designer, started working for Gainax in Gunbuster and Fushigi no Umi no Nadia. He left Gainax to join Gonzo, where he developed the character designs for Vandread.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

[Website](https://www.donnaburke.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/db_singer_actor) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwl3O6yIEVSY49XwOS1QTpA)

Donna Burke is an Australian voice actress, singer, narrator and businesswoman.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/KANETAKE)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/64664693)

Yamamoto's interest in working in the anime industry piqued in high school after realizing how noticeable the difference in episodes were depending on the episode director in charge. One of his favourites shows included [Seisenshi Dunbine](https://anilist.co/anime/929/).

In the late '80s, he joined [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/) as a production assistant after finding out that it's how many of the studio's directors started off. There he met and studied under [Shuuji Iuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/115833/) on his shows [Madou King Granzort](https://anilist.co/anime/2818/) and [Mashin Eiyuuden Wataru](https://anilist.co/anime/4807/). Then after having gone freelance he got his first shot as a director as one of the three unit directors on Iuchi's [Ranma ½ film](https://anilist.co/anime/418/) in 1991.

In 2001, Yamamoto made his debut as a series director on [Shiawase Sou no Okojo-san](https://anilist.co/anime/2934/), soon after which he worked as the first director of the long-running [Keroro Gunsou](https://anilist.co/anime/516/). In 2006 he directed the well-received [NHK ni Youkoso!](https://anilist.co/anime/1210/)

More recent directorial works of his include [Yama no Susume](https://anilist.co/anime/14355/) and [Shounen Maid](https://anilist.co/anime/21321/).
__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bbkoichi21)__

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shinji_higuchi)

A notable director, special effects director and designer working on both tokusatsu and anime.

He started his career in 1984 working on Godzilla as a modeler for the monsters. The same year he joined Daicon Film, working on the special effects of the tokusatsu movie *Yamata no Orochi no Gyakushu*, and later became one of the founding members of [Studio Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/).

In 1992 he established Studio [GONZO](https://anilist.co/studio/3/) alongside other ex-Gainax staff [Shouji Murahama](https://anilist.co/staff/119708/), [Hiroshi Yamaguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/97308/) and [Mahiro Maeda](https://anilist.co/staff/100392/).

His most notable achievements in tokusatsu are working as special effects director for *Gamera: Guardian of the Universe* (1995), and as both special effects director and director, on *Shin Godzilla* (2016).
He is a professional screenwriter for anime, drama and theater and is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

Originating from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

_Note: Not to be confused with either the [Duel Masters character designer](https://anilist.co/staff/185645/) or the [studio coordinator](https://anilist.co/staff/172956/)._
